newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian bond curve flattens to month low.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bond curve flattens to month low.

text.p: The Australian futures curve closed at its flattest level since early September after the short end of the curve weakened when bullish expectations that a rate cut would be announced were disappointed.
It was the flattest close since September 6. Since then the curve has held mostly above 70 points,

Spreads to offshore bonds narrowed at the open of trade as the market soared to 2-1/2 year highs, but bonds soon ran into profit-taking and were further dented by the absence of the rate cut, and spreads to offshore bonds widened.
Long bonds received some late support, seeing their spreads close flat on the day, while the short end spreads remained wider through the afternoon.
However, as a rate cut remains well factored into the market, traders said despite today's pullback spreads should remain well supported.
The reduction in the premium to NZ bonds was accentuated by the continuing rumours of samurai issues into that market.
